overview: This subject introduces students to family-centered practice and engaging with families across the life course. Theories of family engagement are explored in the context of contemporary social work practice. The course will have a particular emphasis on the development of practice skill.
intended learning outcomes: Articulate the theoretical foundations of social work practice with families;
Identify the key elements and logic of family systems. using a social work lens; and
Describe the development of social work practice with families over time.

assessments.description: x1 audio visual recorded interview. 15 minutes
Hurdle - attendance at minimum 75% of tutorials. Hurdle requirement:. Attendance at a minimum of 75% of tutorials throughout the teaching period is a hurdle requirement

February.Contact hours: 24 contact hours (8 x 1 hour lecture, 8 x 2 hour tutorial)

Prescribed texts: Collins, D., Jordan, C., & Coleman, H. (2012). Brooks/Cole empowerment series: An introduction to family social work. Nelson Education.
